feed.title: Google Cloud: Document AI
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Document AI

entry.content: Custom extractor model pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5.1-2025-08-07 with improved adaptive few-shot learning is available as Release Candidate (Preview).
entry.summary: The new pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5.1-2025-08-07 Custom Extractor model is now in Release Candidate. This update features enhanced adaptive few-shot learning capabilities. Try it now as a preview.
entry.title: Feature: Improved Custom Extractor Model Now Available

entry.content:
Capacity reservation is available for Document AI in preview. This lets you grant capacity to selected processors and maintain a steady real-time, high-volume processing flow for document processing requests.

For the necessary steps, read make a capacity reservation request.
entry.summary: Capacity reservation for Document AI is now available in preview. This feature allows you to reserve capacity for selected processors, ensuring a steady flow of document processing requests. Refer to the provided link for instructions on how to make a reservation.
entry.title: Announcement: Capacity reservation for Document AI

entry.content:
Custom classifier model pretrained-classifier-v1.5-2025-08-05 powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash is in Preview. It has ML processing available for US and EU regions, a maximum page limit of 30 pages, and processing requests of 120 pages per minute.

Unlike the prior custom classifier, which used classical machine learning, this version features a new platform. It accommodates:

  • High accuracy immediately, based on the document classes you define.
  • Few-shot learning to further improve accuracy.
  • Use of descriptions when labeling for more context and insight for document classes.
  • More accurate results with the same training dataset on the fine-tuned generative AI model, compared to the trained version.
  • Autolabeling documents for fine-tuning and evaluation.
  • Generative AI to fine-tune and heighten accuracy.

For more information on processor versions, see Managing processor versions.
entry.summary: Introducing the new Custom Classifier powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash, now in Preview. It offers improved accuracy with generative AI, few-shot learning, and autolabeling.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Classifier

entry.content:
Custom Extractor version pretrained-foundation-model-v1.4-2025-02-05 will no longer be accessible on February 5, 2026.

To avoid service disruptions, migrate to a later version such as pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05 or pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-pro-2025-06-20. To learn more about the migration process, refer to our Manage processor versions documentation.
entry.summary: The Custom Extractor version pretrained-foundation-model-v1.4-2025-02-05 will be deprecated on February 5, 2026. Please migrate to a newer version to avoid service disruption.
entry.title: Deprecated: Custom Extractor version deprecated

entry.content:
Document AI supports two service tiers and associated quotas: provisioned and best effort tiers.

The base is provisioned tier quota, which provides 120 pages per minute for Gemini 2.0 and 2.5 Flash LLM and 30 pages per minute for Gemini 2.5 Pro LLM.

If you require more volume, best effort tier quota provides 120 pages per minute for Gemini 2.0 2.5 Flash and 60 pages per minute for Gemini 2.5 Pro, and is only used once the provisioned quota has been exhausted. This applies to quotas BestEffortOnlineProcessDocumentPagesPerMinutePerProjectUS, and EU, and best_effort_online_process_document_pages_us and eu in the console.

Best effort can get up to 240 pages per minute for custom data extractor models v1.4 and v1.5 with a quota increase request (QIR). You can make a QIR by contacting your sales team representative.

There is no service level agreement (SLA) for best effort tier.
entry.summary: Document AI offers two service tiers: provisioned and best effort, each with different page-per-minute quotas for various Gemini models. The best effort tier can provide higher volumes, especially for custom extractor models, but does not have a service level agreement.
entry.title: Announcement: Document AI Service Tiers

entry.content:
Custom extractor model pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-pro-2025-06-20 is available as General Availability (GA).

For more information about available models, see the custom extractor page.
entry.summary: The custom extractor model `pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-pro-2025-06-20` has reached General Availability. This powerful new model enhances document processing capabilities.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Extractor Model Now Available

entry.content:
Derived entity and signature detection are now supported in Custom Extractor models pretrained-foundation-model-v1.4-2025-02-05 as General Availability (GA) and pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05, as well as pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-pro-2025-06-20 as Preview.

Signature detection lets you identify handwritten signatures by using visual cues in the document. Derived entity detection lets you deduce entities by inference without requiring the value to be explicitly present in the text. You can use this feature to deduce the country in an address, counting items in a table, or detecting if an ID is fake.

These can be enabled in the console when creating labels or by using the DocumentSchema.EntityType resource in the API.

For more information, read Custom extractor with derived fields and choose label attributes.
entry.summary: Derived entity and signature detection are now supported in Custom Extractor models as General Availability and Preview. Signature detection identifies handwritten signatures, while derived entity detection deduces entities by inference. These features can be enabled in the console or via the API.
entry.title: Feature: Derived Entity and Signature Detection Now Available for Custom Extractor Models

entry.content:
Custom extractor model pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-pro-2025-06-20 powered by Gemini 2.5 Pro is in Public Preview. It has ML processing available for US and EU regions, and 30 page per minute processing requests.

For more information, see Managing processor versions.
entry.summary: A new custom extractor model powered by Gemini 2.5 Pro is now available in Public Preview. This feature offers ML processing for US and EU regions with a processing speed of 30 pages per minute.
entry.title: Feature: New Custom Extractor Model Now in Public Preview

entry.content:
Document AI now supports Identity and Access Management (IAM) deny policies. These policies allow you to define deny rules that prevent certain principals from using certain permissions to access Google Cloud resources, regardless of the roles they're granted.

For more information, read Deny policy overview and Document AI security and compliance.
entry.summary: Document AI now supports IAM deny policies, which allow you to create rules that restrict access to Google Cloud resources.
entry.title: Feature: IAM Deny Policies Now Supported in Document AI

entry.content:
Document AI VPC service controls (VPC-SC) integration now supports identity groups.

For more information on setting up VPC-SC identity groups, read Configure identity groups and third-party identities in ingress and egress rules.
entry.summary: Document AI now supports identity groups for VPC Service Controls. This enhancement allows for more granular control over data access by enabling the use of identity groups in VPC-SC security policies. For setup instructions, refer to the provided documentation.
entry.title: Feature: Document AI VPC-SC Now Supports Identity Groups

entry.content:
The Document AI CDE processor now supports merging the child entities of nested entities that extend across several pages. This is supported in custom extractor model pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05.

This change is automatically present in existing and newly created processors.

For customers with existing v1.5 processors to make use of this feature, you must relabel the nested entities in different pages.

To learn more about the labeling process, refer to our Label documents documentation.
entry.summary: The Document AI CDE processor now supports merging child entities across pages for nested entities. This feature is available in the pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05 custom extractor model and is automatically enabled for all processors. For existing v1.5 processors, relabeling nested entities across pages is necessary to utilize this enhancement.
entry.title: Feature: Document AI CDE Processor Now Merges Nested Entities Across Pages

entry.content:
Custom Extractor model pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05 is in General Availability (GA) and has fine-tuning available for the US and EU.

From version v1.4 and later, we will use a new quota for online processing called Number of online process document pages per minute per processor type and model version. This quota will be enforced at a per-page and per-foundation model level. There will be no change to the batch processing quota.

These can be enabled in the console when creating labels and by using the DocumentSchema.EntityType.

For more information, read Managing processor versions.
entry.summary: The new Custom Extractor model version, pretrained-foundation-model-v1.5-2025-05-05, is now generally available with fine-tuning support for US and EU regions. Online processing will now be subject to a new quota based on pages per minute, per processor type and model version, while batch processing quotas remain unchanged. You can enable these features in the console or via the DocumentSchema API.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Extractor model now available

entry.content:
We've increased the maximum file size for online processing requests from 20 MB to 40 MB. This applies to all types of processors.

For more information, see the Document AI limits page.
entry.summary: You can now upload files up to 40 MB for online processing with all Document AI processor types. This doubles the previous limit and allows for larger documents to be processed.
entry.title: Feature: Increased file size limit for online processing
